refnamediv.refpurpose: The configuration file for Remote Telescope System, 2nd version

refsect1.title: SYNOPSIS
refsect1.para: The rts2.ini file is a configuration file for the RTS2. rts2.ini contains runtime configuration information for the RTS2 programs. The complete description of the file format and possible parameters held within are here for reference purposes.

refsect1.title: FILE FORMAT
refsect1.para: The file consists of sections and parameters. A section begins with the name of the section in square brackets and continues until the next section begins. Sections contain parameters of the form:
The file is line-based - that is, each newline-terminated line represents either a comment, a section name or a parameter.
Section and parameter names are not case sensitive.

Only the first equals sign in a parameter is significant. Whitespace before or after the first equals sign is discarded. Leading, trailing and internal whitespace in section and parameter names is irrelevant. Leading and trailing whitespace in a parameter value is discarded. Internal whitespace within a parameter value is retained verbatim.
Any line beginning with a semicolon (``;'') or a hash (``#'') character is ignored, as are lines containing only whitespace.

The values following the equals sign in parameters are all either a string (no quotes needed) or a boolean, which may be given as yes/no, 0/1 or true/false. Case is not significant in boolean values, but is preserved in string values. Some items such as create modes are numeric.

refsect1.title: IMAGE PATH EXPRESSION
refsect1.para: Image path expression is processed before it is used.

refsect2.title: Example of image path expression
refsect2.para: If we have FITS file with name which was taken (based on RTS2 CTIME and USEC) on 2006-10-17 at 18:22:03.447s, with R filter (RTS2 FILTER keyword). Here we list few path expresions together with expected values.

listitem.para: @DATE-OBS/R/20061017182203-0447.fits, if DATE-OBS keyword cannot be found.

refsect1.para: Substrings begining with @ are escaped to keyword value with name equal to value characters and number only string which follows. If this value is not found in header, string @[name] will be put to path, where [name] is string after @.
For example, string @DATE-OBS will be expanded to keyword value of DATE-OBS keyword. If DATE-OBS keyword cannot be found, it will be copied, e.g. remain @DATE-OBS.
Substrings begining with % are expanded to various image-related values. They list is provided bellow.

refsect2.title: database
refsect2.para: Provides configuration values necessary to connect to database.

listitem.para: Database name. Database must be properly configured. Command psql [name] must work for root or user specified with username and password.
Database username. This user should have write access to important RTS2 tables (observations,..), otherwise RTS2 will not be able to record important values.
Database password. It is used with username to login to database specified by name.

refsect2.title: observatory
refsect2.para: Provide informations about observatory - its location etc.

listitem.para: Observatory altitute in meters. It is recorded to images.
Observatory longitude in degrees. Positive values are east from Greenwich, negative are west - e.g. American locations should have negative longitude, most of European positive.

Observatory latitude in degrees. Positive values are for northern hemisphere locations, negative for southern hemisphere - e.g. Republic of South Africa locations should have negative values, all Europe locations positive.
Minimum altitude for an object to be selected. Entered in degrees.
Epoch id. Epochs are used to divide observatory data to packages which can be easily backed on tapes/DVDs.
Sun is below horizon, when its calculated altitude is bellow that value. Default to 0 degrees.
Night starts, when sun gets below that value Default to -10 degrees.
Horizon file. This file contains list of horizon hour angle and declination, both in degrees. Horizon is estimated by linear approximation between two sucessive points.
Horizon points can be given in hour angle and declination (HA-DEC) or azimuth and altitude format (AZ-ALT). For details, please consult rts2-horizon1 man page.
Images are stored on this path before they are processed. Default value is "%b/que/%c/%f".
Images are stored on this path for acqusition. Default value is "%b/acqusition/%t/%c/%f".
Good images are stored at this location. Those images form the processed image archive. Default value is "%b/archive/%t/%c/object/%f".
Bad images are stored at this location. Default value is "%b/trash/%t/%c/%f".
Flat images are stored at this location. Default value is "%b/flat/%c/raw/%f".
Bad images are stored at this location. Default value is "%b/darks/%c/%f".

Stepping type for model target. Default value is 2, which will take 2 steps on the net defined in model table. -1 is for linear model, where step is increased by factor of 1, and -2 is for completly random model, which will not make points on the net.

refsect2.title: centrald
refsect2.para: Centrald information, such as if system should be put to off state each morning, or if it should be "on" after reboot.

listitem.para: Logfile for centrald. Can be set to '-' to log to stderr.
If set to true, centrald will switch it's state to OFF each morning.

If set to true, centrald will switch it's state to ON after reboot. It's more wise to leave that value to false, as you will then switch the setup on once you will regain connection to the RTS2 computer.

refsect2.title: calibration
refsect2.para: Provides infomations for calibration target - target 6 and Landold (or other) calibration selection.

listitem.para: Maximal airmass distance for calibration targets. This value set step size in airmass calibartion table. If set to 0.1, airmass calibration table will have steps by 0.1, so targets on airmass 1.3 and 1.4 will belong to diferent class and both will be considered for observation in calibration target. If both targets have airmass between 1.35 and 1.45, only one of them will be considered for observation.Defaults to 0.1.
Minimal lunar distance for calibration targets to be considered for selection. It's recorded in degrees, defaults to 20.
Calibration valid time. If we take at given airmass range image within last valid_time seconds, observing this target is not a high priority.

Calibration maximal time in seconds. After that time, calibration observation will receive max_bonus bonus. Between valid_time and max_delay, bonus is calculated as: {min_bonus} + (({time from last image}-{valid_time})/({max_delay}-{valid_time}))*({max_bonus}-{min_bonus}). Default to 7200.
Calibration minimal bonus. Calibration bonus will not be lower then this value. Default to 1.
Calibration maximal bonus. Calibration bonus will not be greater then this value. Default to 300.

refsect2.title: grbd
refsect2.para: Provides values for GRB daemon configuration and GRB observing informations.

listitem.para: Port which will be opened by GRBD either for listening (if server is filled with "-") or which will be contacted on server, if server is filled. If you have allowed direct connection from the GCN machine (capella.gsfc.nasa.gov), you should put there port number negotiated with GCN. If you do not have direct connection and use some sort of the forwarding mechanism (ussing ssh tunnels or bacofwd), put there number to which port grbd should connect.
Location of GRB server. "-" when GRBD should open listening connection, or hostname (or IP address) of GRB relaying server. Please see port parameter for futher discussion.

If distance for GCN update of GRB position is bellow this value, it is assumed that GRB is still in FOV of the instrument and immediate slew will not be commanded. If distance of telescope is above seplimit, immediate telescope movement will be commanded.

Optional binary, which will be passed various parameters about GRB. On command line, this program will receive values (in following order) of tar_id grb_id grb_seqn grb_type grb_ra grb_dec grb_is_grb grb_date grb_errorbox and grb_isnew. Those values are:
tar_id
Target ID taken from RTS2 database.
grb_id
GCN GRB target id. Be aware, that different values are ussually assigned by GCN for observations of same GRB with different satellite.
grb_seqn
Sequence number assigned from GCN. Please see GCN for details.
grb_type
Type number of GCN packet. Please see GCN for details.
grb_ra
J2000 RA of GRB location. In degrees (0-360 range).
grb_dec
J2000 DEC of GRB location. In degrees (-90 to 90 range).
grb_errorbox
GRB errorbox. In degrees.
grb_isnew
1 if this is new GRB, 0 if this message is update of an already know GRB.

True if GRB marked by GCN are labelled as non-GRB events, e.g. originating from know source variability, should be followed. Defaults to true. This option should be left true while system is in testing phase, as fake grb provide good tests of the system, but once it reach maturity, it is wise to switch know_transients to false.

Time for which GRB observing request will be valid. After that time, GRB will not be observed by automatic update. If zero, then GRB observing request will never expires, but will be observed governed by GRB merit function.

refsect2.title: swiftfov
refsect2.para: Provides parameters for Swift target - target 10.

listitem.para: Minimal height above horizon for target to be considered. Defaults to 0. A Swift FOV with heigh lover then the min_horizon parameter will not be considered for observation.

Targets with altitude bellow soft_horizon will be assigned altitude of soft_horizon. This is interesting for widefield systems, which would like to follow Swift which center is bellow horizon. Defaults to the "min_horizon" parameter.
Path for image processing script. Image processing script is called on every obtained image. The only parameter passed to the script is full path of the image.
Glob pattern (e.g. * are allowed) for images. Those images are processed when system is in day or standby/off state.
Timeout for astrometry processing. Astrometry script run time is limited to this number of seconds.
Observation processing script. Script is passed ID of observation which shall be processed. Script is run after all observation images were called through astrometry script.
Dark images processing script. Script is run without any parameter at the end of dark images acqusition.
Flat images processing script. Script is run without any parameter at the end of flat image acqusition.
Space separated list of targets types which will not be considered for observation during night. Usually you would like to put there flat fields - f and F.

refsect2.title: Device configuration
refsect2.para: Device is configured in section which is named by its name. So if you have camera called C0 in the system, you must put its configuration values to [C0] section in rts2.ini.

listitem.para: X plate size in arc seconds. Size of one pixel along X axis. This value is used for ; astrometry package (past) to enable calculation of precise position.
Y plate size in arc seconds. Size of one pixel along X axis. This value is used for ; astrometry package (past) to enable calculation of precise position.

Camera rotational angle. This value is angle between X axis and north direction on image plate. ROTANG is also affected by telescope flip and derotator setting, so for definite value either see rts2-mon or ROTANG entry in the FITS headers.

Camera rotational angle. This value is angle between X axis and north direction on image plate. ROTANG is also affected by telescope flip and derotator setting, so for definite value either see rts2-mon or ROTANG entry in the FITS headers.
X Optical Axis ofset in pixels. This value describes where on which CCD pixel is located telescope optical axis. Can be a float value. Defaults to half of the X detector pixel size.
Y Optical Axis ofset in pixels. This value describes where on which CCD pixel is located telescope optical axis. Can be a float value. Defaults to half of the Y detector pixel size.
Camera flip. If north is along positive X axis, flip is 0 when west is along positive Y axis, and 1 if west is along negative Y axis. Defaults to 1.
Minimal value for good flat image.
Maximal value for good flat image.
Exposures (in seconds) for dark images.
Default filter name.
Default script for device.
Devices which blocks this device. Default is empty - then all devices will block it.
FITS header entries. Instrument name.
Telescope name.
Institution/observer.
Space separated list of environmental variables names, which should be recorded to FITS header.
FITS header comment for the environmental variable with name VARIABLE. You can of course specify any name you like.
